commit.message:
configure: only req CMake if we're building LLVM

CMake is only necessary if LLVM is going to be built and not in any
other case.

Signed-off-by: Doug Goldstein <cardoe@cardoe.com>

verification.payload:
tree 49d7f4e5fe8e8b2f52d3747d4d70feeaf2e47e50
parent f50dbd580f3d5d88a300da540db3c85164bfd0de
author Doug Goldstein <cardoe@cardoe.com> 1480689783 -0600
committer Doug Goldstein <cardoe@cardoe.com> 1480699377 -0600

configure: only req CMake if we're building LLVM

CMake is only necessary if LLVM is going to be built and not in any
other case.

Signed-off-by: Doug Goldstein <cardoe@cardoe.com>

files.patch:
@@ -848,7 +848,10 @@ then
 fi
 
 # For building LLVM
-probe_need CFG_CMAKE cmake
+if [ -z "$CFG_LLVM_ROOT" ]
+then
+  probe_need CFG_CMAKE cmake
+fi
 
 # On MacOS X, invoking `javac` pops up a dialog if the JDK is not
 # installed. Since `javac` is only used if `antlr4` is available,
